page.title: 08Dunnington Heath Farm
page.content: The farm consists of 3 main enterprises, a fruit farm, a 'Pick Your Own' arrangement and the farm shop. The fruit farm grows apples and pears for market in Leicester and Northampton. There are about 80 acres of eating apples. These apples are picked, sorted and put into cold storage until market prices are good. The trees are replaced every 12 to 15 years. There are 40 acres of cooking apples. The varieties grown are Bramley, Howgate Wonder and Early Victoria. The 'Pick Your Own' area has 30 acres of strawberries, about an acre of tomatoes, an acre of sweetcorn and the same of beetroot, an area of raspberries and a small area of peas.The farm shop sells fruit, vegetables and eggs produced on the farm. Mr and Mrs Beach rent the farm from the Marquess of Hertford.
